articles.title: With few entry tests, Southeast Asia may gain most from China's travel revival - CNA
articles.description: SINGAPORE: Southeast Asia's tourist economies are set to be leading beneficiaries of China's scrapping of travel bans as they have steered clear of the COVID-19 tests before entry that Europe, Japan and the United States have imposed on Chinese visitors. Even…
articles.content: In 2019, 155 million Chinese travelled abroad, spending US$254.6 billion, or close to the GDP of Vietnam, said Citi, whose researchers expect "meaningful recovery" in mass tourism to start in the sec… [+1732 chars]
